page.title: 04LOCAL NEWS AND EVENTS
page.content: Most important news stories were of strikes,mainly the miners strike,from March 84 to March 85.There were talks in Jan 85 of a breakaway union in Yorkshire.Another strike was at Mackintosh's sweet factory,where 660 were to be laid off.A Â£1000 grant was given to a Castleford painting firm by W.M.D.C.,also the go-ahead for a taxi stand in Albion St. was passed.Fire services attended 217 house fires,202 grass fires,139 chimney fires,63 special service calls,92 hoax false alarms,88 genuine false alarms.The big fire was at Carrefour supermarket.Over the year 2 rescues and no deaths occurred.1985 police figures showed:house burglary 160 cases,other burglary 270,deception 32,thefts 936.Accident casualties were:fatal 0, serious 8,slight 46 and 55 missing persons reported.
